overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a heuristic approach to time-series forecasting with limited historical data (96 hourly points). The analyst prioritizes pattern recognition and practical constraints over complex models, focusing on daily/weekly seasonality and handling data limitations through simple replication strategies. The approach is pragmatic but acknowledges uncertainty due to insufficient historical data for robust modeling.
common_data_patterns: Shift in daytime values (negative to positive afternoons on weekdays)
key_insights: Prioritization of most recent weekday (Monday) as template for future forecasts due to recency and contextual relevance
Explicit handling of data scarcity (only 4 days historical data) by simplifying model selection
Comparative analysis of weekday patterns (Friday vs Monday) to inform forecasting decisions
Rejection of averaging across dissimilar days (weekdays/weekends) to preserve pattern integrity
complexity_analysis: Moderate complexity: Combines data pattern recognition, multiple method evaluations, and contextual justifications, but constrained by data limitations preventing advanced statistical modeling.
